Column Comment.0: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.1: PROPERTY OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique observation number for theproperty of the substance in this row.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AVERAGE VALUE: The average or single value assigned to this specification. If onlyone mesuare is provided, it should be stored here.
Column Comment.6: CODE VALUE: the codified value noted for the substance property
Column Comment.7: COST: A value associated with the cost of a specification, such as annual operatingcost.
Column Comment.8: CURRENCY CONVERSION: A number which, when multipled by the stored value,will re-create the original value in the original currency used.
Column Comment.9: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The units of measure in which thecurrency was originally received.
Column Comment.11: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.12: DETAIL IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for detail record about an instrument.
Column Comment.13: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.14: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.15: MAXIMUM DATE: the maximum date, such as an expiry date, that describes thisproduct.
Column Comment.16: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum measured or observed value for this property.
Column Comment.19: MINUMUM DATE: the minimum date associated with a specification, such as a datethat a product cannot be used for, such as for aging processes.
Column Comment.20: MINIMUM VALUE: the minimum measured or observed value for this property.
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: REFERENCE VALUE: the value of a reference point. For example may be a date orevent, or a process. In substances may be used to indicate reflectance under certainlight conditions, or solubility at a specific temperature.
Column Comment.25: REFERENCE VALUE TYPE: In the case where a detail is referenced to some othervalue (such as a submission due after a certain period, or a date or an activity), thetype of reference value is captured here. The values, if relevant, are stored inassociated column
Column Comment.27: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.28: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.29: SUBSTANCE PROPERTY TYPE: Valid properties that may be defined inSUBSTANCE PROPERTY DETAIL. This is parent to the control column, which isused to control the behavior of properties that are entered into SUBSTANCEPROPERTY TYPE. Care should be taken in populating and managing this table,taking into account the VERTICAL TABLE procedure recommendations in the PPDMWIKI.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
